resources.string: Select an activity to record data.
Use the user name and password you used when you registered with the Atlas of Living Australia
Unable to contact the server. Please check your internet connection and try again.
The server encountered an error - please try again later.

Welcome to the Green Army Mobile application. To get started, select a project by tapping the home icon or swiping right from the left hand edge of the screen. If you do not have any projects assigned to you, please contact your service provider to get this corrected.
No activities found. If your expected activities are missing, please contact your service provider to have this corrected.

Welcome to the Green Army Programme application. Before you get started, you will need to:
 1. Create an account with the Atlas of Living Australia.
 2. Ask your service provider to add you as an editor for your projects in the MERIT tool.

If you already have an account, please ensure your device has internet access and press the "Start" button to login.
Welcome to the Green Army mobile application. To get started, tap one of your projects in the list on the left hand side of the screen.
Your device doesn\'t appear to be connected to the network. The map may not be visible, however your location will be found using GPS
The GPS on this device is currently disabled, do you want to enable it? Enabling GPS will allow accurate activity locations to be recorded.
Please correct the errors and try again
Waiting to sync with the server....
Waiting for a more accurate location
The system is unable to determine your position accurately. Please update the site location using the MERIT website when you have internet access.
The site cannot be created as the system is unable to determine your location. Please tap back then create the site location using the MERIT website when you have internet access.
Are you sure you want to logout?\n Any edits not yet synced to the server will be lost.

1. LEGAL CONTRACT
1.1 This agreement is a legal contract between you and the Commonwealth of Australia as represented by the Department of the Environment ABN 34 190 894 983 of John Gorton Building, King Edward Terrace, Parkes, ACT, 2600 ("Department") regarding your right to use the Green Army Programme reporting application (the "Application").
1.2 If you want to install and use the Application you must agree to be bound by this agreement. By using the Application, you will be deemed to have accepted and agreed to be bound by this agreement.

2. LICENCE 1.1 The Department and its licensors retain all right, title and interest, including copyright, patents and other intellectual property rights, in and to the Application. You do not acquire any right, title or interest in or to the Application except as expressly provided for in this agreement.
1.2 The Department grants you a royalty free, non-exclusive, non-transferrable, limited licence to use the Application on your Portable Device only for the sole purpose of complying with your, or your employer’s, reporting requirements under the Principal Agreement, and otherwise in accordance with the Google Play Terms of Service.
1.3 You must not:
(a) use, operate, copy, distribute, sell, sublicense, rent or modify the Application except as expressly permitted by this agreement;
(b) use the Application in a manner that violates any law or regulation;
(c) reverse engineer, decompile, disassemble or otherwise create or attempt to create the source code of the Application;
(d) operate or sub-license the Application for the benefit of a third party;
(e) remove, alter or add to any copyright notice or similar marking on the Application;
(f) use the Application outside of Australia; or
(g) use the Application in any way other than as permitted under this agreement and the Google Play Terms of Service.
1.4 You must:
(a) comply with such security policies and procedures as notified by the Department from time to time in relation to the maintenance and use of the Application; and
(b) as applicable, comply with, and not do anything to place your employer in breach of, any and all provisions set out in the Principal Agreement (where for the purposes of this agreement the use of the Application by you is deemed to be part of the services or activities to be provided or delivered by you or your employer under the Principal Agreement).

3. ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS
3.1 This agreement does not require the Department to implement or install the Application for you or to provide any maintenance, support or other services in respect of the Application.
3.2 You acknowledge that you have had the opportunity to review the Google Play Terms of Service.
3.3 You acknowledge that the Application will utilise your Portable Device for the purposes of transmitting and receiving information, and that:
(a) this transfer of information is facilitated by your telecommunications carriage provider using your carriage and data plan;
(b) the Department is not responsible for the provision of any carriage services; and
(c) the Department is not liable for any costs or charges incurred by you as a result of your use of the Application.
3.4 You represent and warrant that:
(a) you are not located in a country that is subject to a United States Government embargo or that has been designated by the United States Government as a “terrorist supporting” country; and
(b) you are not listed on any United States Government list of prohibited or restricted parties.
3.5 You acknowledge that although the Application may be used, or may only operate, in conjunction with other products and services offered by the Department (“Related Products and Services”), the Related Products and Services are licensed separately and this agreement does not affect any rights or obligations in relation to Related Products and Services.
3.6 To the extent permitted by law, the Department neither warrants nor represents that your use or possession of the Application will not infringe the rights of third parties.
3.7 The names, icons, words, titles, phrases, logos, trade marks or service marks, graphics or designs and other content (together, the “Trade Marks”) displayed through the Application are the Department\'s property or the property of other parties and may be registered or unregistered trade marks. Nothing contained in this agreement or the Application should be construed as a licence or right to use any Trade Mark without the Department\'s written permission or the permission of the third party that may own the Trade Mark. Misuse of any Trade Mark is prohibited. The Department reserves the right to enforce its intellectual property rights through civil proceedings.

4. LIABILITY
4.1 Where any law implies or applies in this agreement any condition, warranty or guarantee, and that law avoids or prohibits provisions in a contract excluding or modifying the application of or exercise of or liability under the condition, warranty or guarantee, the condition, warranty or guarantee is deemed to be included in this agreement. However, to the extent permitted by law, the Department\'s liability for failure to comply with any such condition, warranty or guarantee is limited (at the Department\'s option, and as determined by it) to:
(a) in the case of goods - to the replacement of the goods or the supply of equivalent goods, the repair of the goods, the payment of the cost of replacing the goods or of acquiring equivalent goods or the payment of the cost of having the goods replaced (as determined by the Department); and
(b) in the case of services - to the supplying of the services again or the payment of the cost of having the services supplied again (as determined by the Department).
4.2 Except as specified in clause 4.1, under no circumstances will the Department be liable to you for any loss, damages, claims or costs whatsoever (including any consequential, indirect or incidental damages) arising under or in connection with this Agreement or your use of the Application, regardless of how they arise.

5. VARIATION
5.1 The Department reserves the right to vary this agreement and will ensure that the amended agreement is placed on its website.
5.2 The Department recommends that you check this from time to time. Your continued use of the Application means that you agree to be bound by any changes that may be made by the Department and posted on its website.
5.3 Without limiting your obligations under clauses 5.1 and 5.2, the Department will use reasonable endeavours to also give you notice of a variation to the terms of this agreement by sending you an email directing you to review the relevant variation on the Department\'s website. The notice will be sent to the email address registered by you when you downloaded the Application.

6. TERMINATION
6.1 The Department may immediately terminate this agreement and your right to use the Application by notice to you at any time for any reason (in the absolute discretion of the Department), including without limitation where the Application is replaced or becomes redundant (as determined by the Department).
6.2 The Department may immediately by notice to you terminate this agreement, and your right to use the Application, if you breach any of the terms of this agreement.
6.3 Upon termination of this agreement, the accrued rights and liabilities of the parties shall not be affected.
6.4 You may terminate this agreement at any time by written notice to the Department.
6.5 Upon termination of this agreement you must stop using, uninstall and destroy all copies of the Application in your possession or control (including on your Portable Device).
6.6 Notice by the Department to you under this clause will be by the sending of an email to the address registered by you when you downloaded the Application

7. DEPARTMENT CONTACT DETAILS
If you have any questions, complaints or claims in relation to the Application, you can contact the Department as follows:
Name: Director, Monitoring and Reporting Section, Biodiversity Conservation Division
Postal address: GPO Box 787, Canberra, ACT, 2601
Physical address: John Gorton Building, King Edward Terrace, Parkes, ACT, 2600
Telephone: 1800 803 772 or (02) 6274 1111
Email: MERIT@environment.gov.au

8. GENERAL
8.1 You may not assign, transfer or otherwise deal with the rights under this agreement without the prior written consent of the Department.
8.2 This agreement will be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws in force in the Australian Capital Territory and each party submits to the non-exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of that Territory.
8.3 If any provision of this agreement is held unenforceable or illegal for any reason, the agreement will remain otherwise in full force apart from the provision which will be deemed deleted.

9. DEFINITIONS
Application has the meaning given in clause 1.1.
Department has the meaning given in clause 1.1.
Google Play Terms of Service means the terms of service (as amended from time to time) of the online application marketplace known as Google Play, and at commencement of this agreement available at the uniform resource locator https://play.google.com/intl/en-GB_au/about/play-terms.html.
Portable Device means a smartphone, tablet, laptop or other portable device capable of operating the Application and owned or controlled by you.
Principal Agreement means the agreement between the Department and you or your employer for the purposes of the Green Army Programme or another incidental or related purpose.
Related Products and Services has the meaning given in clause 3.5.
Trade Marks has the meaning given in clause 3.7.
